Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ABE
Definition: This accelerated benefit rider allows the client to take an advance on the policy's death benefit due to long-term, catastrophic, or terminal illness. Also known as living benefits.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ABCOGIMP
Definition: This accelerated benefit rider allows the client to take an advance on the policy's death benefit due to a cognitive impairment.

Description: Accelerated Benefit for Nursing Home Care
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ABNURSINGHOME
Definition: This accelerated benefit rider allows the client to take an advance on the policy's death benefit for nursing home care.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ADD
Definition: The face amount of a life insurance policy is payable if the insured dies or loses any two limbs or the sight of both eyes as the result of an accident.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ADB
Definition: The face amount of a life insurance policy is payable only if the insured dies as the result of an accident. OR It can be sold as a supplementary death benefit rider that provides for an amount of money in addition to the face amount of a life insurance policy. This additional amount is also payable only if the insured dies as the result of an accident.

Description: Accidental Death Benefit - Joint Insured Only
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ADBJOINT
OLI_OPTTYPE_ACCOUNTINGBNFT
Definition: This rider provides a higher cash surrender value on large business cases that meet specified criteria. This rider waives surrender charges for the lifetime of the policy.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ADDSCHED
Definition: A Rider or Option that allows the policyholder to add additional coverage or buy an additional policy within a scheduled period of time. The exercise of the Rider/Option may or may not require special underwriting business rules based upon the carrier's process.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ADJSURVL
Definition: Survivorship life coverage that is adjustable

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_AFFILIATION
Definition: Provides a discount if the applicant is affiliated or otherwise is eligible for a insurer discount.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_AIDS
Definition: This benefit adds the coverage of AIDS and AIDS related diseases to a coverage

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_AIRBAG
Definition: An additional benefit is provided if an air bag is deployed for the covered person during the accident.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ALTCASHSURRVAL
Definition: This rider provides Net Surrender Values for the certain percentage range of specified number of years' premium in highly funded scenarios. Surrender Value prior to a specified anniversary is increased by a percent of cumulative policy loads plus a percentage of surrender charges through a specified policy year.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ALTCV
Definition: This rider lowers the base face amount charges of a policy, while increasing the enhanced no-lapse guarantee rider premium.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ASSUREDDISTOPTION
Definition: This option guarantees the client a specified stream of distributions from their policy value dependent upon the amount of money in the policy's account value.

Description: Auto Adjust of death benefit for tax exempt status
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_AUTOADJUST
Definition: Automatic Adjustment of death benefit for tax exempt status.This option allows for the automatic adjustment of the policy value to the minimum amount necessary to maintain the policy tax exempt status.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_AFPPREMINC
Definition: A contractually agreed increase on the premium payable. This increase percentage if fixed for the period of the contract

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_AUTOINC
Definition: Like cost of living adjustment but is not based on percentage you indicate (e.g. 5%).

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_AILPREMINC
Definition: A contractually agreed increase on the premium payable. This increase is not fixed, but linked to a specified index, i.e. CPI, Stock Exchange indices

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_AVIATION
Definition: An Aviation Exclusion Rider is an addendum that basically makes a policy void should the insured die in an aviation-related accident other than as a fare-paying passenger on a scheduled airline.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_BENEINSUR
Definition: Term insurance on a beneficiary.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_BDR
Definition: Allows the policyowner to designate a portion of the policy's death benefit proceeds to be paid in specified modal payments.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_BSO
Definition: This option allows the clients to reduce the cost of their policy's death benefit by reducing certain charges deducted from the policy.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_BUSVALUEINC
Definition: Automatic increase option that is tied to valuation of the business. As the business value goes up, the face amount of policy increases.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CVTRANSFER
Definition: This is a conversion option to transfer funds from one account to another.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CHGINS
Definition: It is used in deferred comp cases (COLI) where a number of executives are covered and you change executives, you can transfer the plan to the other person.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CHGEARNELIM
Definition: Should say 'Charge'. In early years of policy, where cash value would ordinarily be less than cumulative premiums paid. This causes cash value to be equal to cumulative premiums paid.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CHARITY
Definition: This rider provides an additional death benefit of a specified percentage of the base face amount to a charity designated by the policy owner.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CHILDDISEASE
Definition: Childhood Disease is a specified disease benefit election for select products that provide protection for childhood diseases as defined in the insurance contract.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_EXPCHILD
Definition: The Children's Conversion rider/option allows the policyholder to buy an additional policy for the insured child when the insured child attains the age where they are no longer considered a child (and therefore covered) on the existing policy.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CTB
Definition: Kind of term insurance that covers all of the children of the insured regardless of age or number. Children do not have to be born at the time policy is taken out for them to be covered. Demographic information about the individual children is not collected.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CHRONICILL
Definition: This accelerated benefit rider allows the client to take an advance on the policy's death benefit due to a chronic illness.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CONVALESCARE
Definition: Accelerates the rider's benefit limit for covered long-term care expenses for a specific time period {e.g., 2 years (24 months) or 3 years (36 months)}. The rider's benefit limit is equal to the specified amount of coverage which the insured selects at issue.

Description: Cost of Living Increase or inflation guard
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_COLI
Definition: Tied to government index, usually CPI.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_WPCRIT
Definition: Covers cost of the policy contributions in the event of the principal insured becoming severely ill.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DBDISCRITILL
Definition: Payment of the Coverage Sum Assured will happen in the event of Death, Disability or Critical Illness

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DB
Definition: Payment of the Coverage Sum Assured will happen in the event of death

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DEATHBENGUAR
Definition: This rider ensures that a policy will not lapse before the Insured attains a specified age if premiums paid equal or exceed the death benefit guarantee premium requirement.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DSL
Definition: Benefit that allows owner to designate a second life on the policy

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DIB
Definition: A feature added to some life insurance policies providing for waiver of premium and sometimes payment of monthly income, if the policyholder becomes totally and permanently disabled.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DISCRITILL
Definition: Payment of the Coverage Sum Assured will happen in the event of disability or critical illness.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DISAPP
Definition: Benefits are provided in the event that person is declared legally dead following a disappearance.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DBLINDEM
Definition: Double: An additional accidental death benefit that is equal to the face amount of the life insurance policy. Triple: A type of additional accidental death benefit coverage that pays an additional benefit equal to twice the policy's basic death benefit if the accident is sustained while the insured is a passenger in a public conveyance operated by a licensed common carrier, such as a bus, train, or airplane.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DOWNSIDEPROTECT
Definition: This rider provides protection from extended market losses, protection from policy lapse and minimum death benefit up to specific age.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DRDISEASE
Definition: A defined percentage of the coverage amount is paid as a lump sum if the life insured is diagnosed with any of a range of defined diseases or medical conditions.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ADC
Definition: Accidental Death Benefit with extra benefit for accident on a common carrier (i.e. an airline, taxi, etc.).

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ENHANCEDCV
Definition: Provides an enhanced first year cash surrender value if certain premium requirements are met.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ENHCDDTHBNFT
Definition: Modifies the death benefit to be equal to or higher than what is required to qualify as life insurance. The Death benefit is modified to be at a higher percentage, based on age.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ESTATEPRESERVE
Definition: Provides extra non-convertible coverage during a specified period for future estate tax liability that may be incurred when an existing life insurance policy is transferred to an irrevocable trust.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ESTATEPROT
Definition: The preparation of a plan of administration and disposition of one's property before or after death including will, trusts, gifts, power of attorney, etc.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ESTATETAXREPEAL
Definition: This rider permits the policyowner to terminate the policy without charge if the federal estate tax imposed under the Internal Revenue Code or any similar body of law is repealed.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_EXCIO
Definition: Option to exchange the insured on the policy

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_EXCHANGE
Definition: Provides ability to exchange this policy for a different one (e.g. a term policy for a permanent policy) without submitting evidence for insurability.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_EXTMATURITY
Definition: If person lives past the maturity date, it allows you to extend the maturity of the policy past that date.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ECPO
Definition: Extension of Conversion Period Option - If elected, extends the conversion privilege to equal the level premium paying period chosen for the policy, giving the policyowner a greater opportunity to take advantage of the valuable conversion privilege and upgrade to permanent cash value insurance. Issue ages limits may apply.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_EXPEXTRA
Definition: A Rider or Option on a Coverage which is available until the insured reaches an age specified in the policy documentation. This Option allows the policyholder to add additional coverage or buy an additional policy until he/she reaches the agreed upon age. The exercise of the Rider/Option may or may not require special underwriting business rules based upon the carrier's process.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_FAMILY
Definition: This type of option provides life insurance coverage on the insured's family, including spouse and children. The coverage provided through such an option is term insurance and is often sold on the basis of coverage units and does not vary by actual number of individuals covered. Coverage on the child expires when the child reaches a specified age. Future children are automatically insured after birth, legal adoption, legal guardianship, etc. depending on policy provisions.Family options include the privilege to convert the term part of the contract to permanent insurance, this insurance on dependents will become paid up when the primary insured dies, and there is a decrease in the premium and/or automatic increase in the amount of insurance on the primary insured if his or her spouse dies first.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_FEMDRDDISEASE
Definition: Covers specific female dread diseases or impairments. It will pay out if diagnosed with one of those diseases or impairments in a lump sum.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_FUNCIMP
Definition: Pays in the event of specified functional impairments.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_FUNERAL
Definition: The specified Funeral Benefit amount forms part of the death benefit available to a beneficiary who has been nominated by the policyholder.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_LIFECONV
Definition: A group policy benefit can be converted to an individual policy

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_GUARIR
Definition: Additional life insurance purchased that has been issued on a guaranteed basis

Description: Guaranteed Issue Option at specified Life Events
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_GRNTEISSUE
Definition: An Option that allows the policyholder to add additional coverage or buy an additional policy at life events specified in the policy without the need to produce evidence of insurability or health, except for a negative HIV test.

Description: Guaranteed Issue Option due to Birth or Adoption
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ADDCHILD
Definition: A Rider or Option that allows the policyholder to add additional coverage or buy an additional policy in the event that the policyholder's family increases by birth or adoption of a child or children. The exercise of the Rider/Option may or may not require special underwriting business rules based upon the carrier's process.

Description: Guaranteed Issue Option due to Marriage
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ADDMARR
Definition: A Rider or Option that allows the policyholder to add additional coverage or buy an additional policy in the event that the policyholder gets married. The exercise of the Rider/Option may or may not require special underwriting business rules based upon the carrier's process.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_HEALTHY
Definition: This rider provides an opportunity for the policy value to earn rider credits based on healthy actions taken by the insured each year through a specified age.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_HIV
Definition: Accelerated benefit rider which pays a portion of death benefit while living, but only in the case of HIV illness.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_HOSPICECARE
Definition: A rider available for care that is intended to provide comfort for the terminal patient and support for their family.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_HOSP
Definition: Covers in the event of the insured being hospitalized, but is linked to the insured amount, not to the amount of hospitalization expenses incurred by the insured

Description: Joint Last to Die Payment on First Death
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_JOINTPAY
Definition: The election of the percentage of policy value to be paid to the surviving insured when the first joint insured dies.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_CATCHALL
Definition: Covers all known and unknown, serious and permanent medical or physical conditions (lump  sum benefit)

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_LIVNEEDS
Definition: This accelerated benefit rider allows the client to take an advance on the policy's death benefit due to long-term, catastrophic, or terminal illness. Also known as accelerated death benefits.

Description: Long Term Care Accelerated Benefit Option
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_LTCABO
OLI_OPTTYPE_LTCNONFOR
Definition: An optional benefit that provides continued (extended) benefits for a shortened duration or a cash refund if a policy lapses after it has been in force for a specified number of years.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_MARITAL
Definition: This discount applies because the individual is married. This is different then Spousal Discount which applies because both spouses are applying together.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_MATERNITY
Definition: Maternity is an income protection benefit that covers loss of income and/or defined medical expenses due to a woman's pregnancy.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_WPMED
Definition: Covers cost of medical aid contributions in the event of the principal insured becoming severely ill, disabled or dies

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_MILITARYAVIATION
Definition: Used to identify whether or not an aviation extra is charged for coverage as the result of the insured's military flying. May also be used under Exclusion to identify that an insured is specifically not covered in the event of death related to military flying.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_NOLAPSE
Definition: An agreement by the insurance company to keep the Universal Life Insurance in force, even if the Cash Value becomes zero or less than zero, provided that a specified Minimum Continuation Premium is made at the required time.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_DISSIMOCC
Definition: Benefit pays in the event of own occupation disability (Permanent Incapacity). This applies to disability payments in event of being unable to exercise own occupation.

Description: Option to Purchase Add'l Ins Underwriting Req'd
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_FTO
Definition: Option to Purchase Additional Insurance, but some underwriting is still required. If accepted, the increased coverage will be issued at the original issue age, not the current attained age.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_OPAI
Definition: Guaranteed insurability rider – has option to increase face amount without evidence of insurability at certain intervals.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_OPR
Definition: The Overloan Protection Rider offers a level of protection to policyholders against lapsing their policy due to excess policy debt. The benefit is specifically designed for clients who take substantial loans. May also be referred to as "Overload Protection Rider."

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PAYORDB
Definition: This option waives the premium if the policy's payor dies. This rider is typically offered to traditional products whose insured is a juvenile.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PAYORDI
Definition: This option waives the premium if the policy's payor (as opposed to insured) becomes disabled. This rider is typically offered to traditional products whose insured is a juvenile.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PPINC
Definition: Combination benefit that covers permanent and or partial incapacitation.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PERSIST
Definition: If you keep the policy for some minimum number of years, insurance company will give you some 'kick in' - typically an interest kicker as a bonus.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PHYSIMP
Definition: Provides cover for physical impairments in the event of diagnosis or occurrence of such impairments, and subject to any applicable waiting period.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SPLIT
Definition: Divorce option, joint survivorship policy – if you get divorced, both spouses have option of converting it into 2 single life policies without proving insurability and incurring surrender charges.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_POOLOFMONEY
Definition: A maximum dollar amount established for the policy which defines the cumulative limit for benefits to be paid based on carrier rules. Commonly, the amount of the pool is established by benefit amount multiplied by benefit time period.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PORT
Definition: Complies with requirements of HIPAA. The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) provides rights and protections for participants and beneficiaries in group health plans. HIPAA includes protections for coverage under group health plans that limit exclusions for preexisting conditions; prohibit discrimination against employees and dependents based on their health status; and allow a special opportunity to enroll in a new plan to individuals in certain circumstances. HIPAA may also give you a right to purchase individual coverage if you have no group health plan coverage available, and have exhausted COBRA or other continuation coverage.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PGO
Definition: The premium will remain the same – neither increase nor decrease.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PREMHOLIDAY
Definition: The Premium Holiday is a benefit that allows the Contracting Party to miss a premium during times of financial difficulty such as retrenchment, unemployment, maternity leave and study leave.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PREMRESERVE
Definition: This rider allows the client to pay premiums in addition to those paid for the policy and have these amounts accumulate in the same manner as the policy without being subject to all charges and expenses of the policy.

Name: OLI_DISCOUNT_PREPAY
Definition: Provides a discount if some portion of future premiums are pre-paid along with the initial premium.

Description: Presumptive Disability for a Specific Loss
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_PRESUMPTDISABLE
Definition: An option available which indicates that the parent rider or coverage, which covers a specific loss, provides a presumption of disability even if the covered individual is still working after the loss. The presumption of disability option causes the claim to be paid if the loss is suffered regardless of actual disability.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_VALUESPLUS
Definition: Values Plus is an option that can be added to a Life Policy to ensure that another carrier's policy's cash values can be "rolled into" this Life Policy

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_QUALADLT
Definition: Provides a discount if a "qualified adults" apply together for policies. Qualified Adult is a person of the same or opposite sex who meets all the criteria listed below.1) He or she is over the age of 18.2) He or she has lived with you for at least 12 months.3) He or she has a serious and committed relationship with you.4) He or she is not legally married nor a Domestic Partner to anyone else.5) He or she is financially interdependent with you Financially interdependent means that you and this person are jointly responsible for the cost of food and housing

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_RELAXMINPREM
Definition: Allows policyholder to pay less than administrative minimum premium. A minimum cash value is required before this option will be supported. Generally has a time frame associated with it.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_REMAINS
Definition: Covers the costs of logistics of preparing and returning your remains to desired location

Description: Respread option for joint/multi-life on 1st death
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_RESPREAD
Definition: Respread or reallocation option for joint/multiple life coverages on first death.This option allows the owner to exercise at the first death of the lives insured, additional insurance coverage on each of the surviving lives insured equal to the amount of the death benefit on the first life, without providing evidence of insurability.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_RETRENCH
Definition: An income replacement type benefit should the client become retrenched from his job (unemployed).This benefit is sold as a standalone OR it can be sold as a supplementary benefit.

Description: Return of Premium - End of Specified Term
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_ROPT
Definition: As defined by the contract, Return of Premium provides for the return of eligible premiums at the end of a defined period, if the insured is still living and the policy is in force.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_COSTREC
Definition: Term insurance rider whose death benefit is equal to the eligible cumulative premiums paid to the policy purpose being if a person dies in any given year, you get back all the premiums. Also known as Cost Recovery.

Description: Return of Premium - on First Death
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_COSTREC1ST
Definition: For joint life policies, the eligible cumulative premium is returned upon the death of the first person. Also known as Cost Recovery.

Description: Return of Premium - on Second Death
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_COSTREC2ND
Definition: For joint life policies, the eligible cumulative premium is returned upon the death of the second person. Also known as Cost Recovery.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_MBGUAR
Definition: On a full surrender, the return of eligible premiums (initial, unplanned, and any Benefit Increase premiums). Also known as Money Back Guarantee.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SALINCREASE
Definition: In the case of life insurance, this is a form of automatic increase option that is tied to multiple of insured's salary.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SEATBELT
Definition: An additional benefit is provided if a seatbelt was used for the covered person during the accident.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SELECTHEALTH
Definition: Provides a discount if the applicant qualifies for the carriers definition of select or good health.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SPOUSAL
Definition: Provides a discount if a couple applies together for policies.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SUICIDE
Definition: Benefits provided in the event of suicide.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SUICIDECLAUSE
Definition: Death attributed to suicide is not covered by some policies for a certain period of time

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SURRCHARGEADJ
Definition: This rider provides a reduction of surrender charges in a carrier defined or optionally selected number of Policy Years. In some cases the surrender charge listed in the contract is multiplied by a percentage that is based on the policy year in which the surrender occurs.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SURRVALUEENHANCE
Definition: This rider enhances the policy's net surrender value. This is commonly done by crediting a portion of cumulative premiums paid and by reducing the surrender charges. The benefit may be only available upon full surrender of the policy and the rider requires a minimum premium.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SURJTTERM
Definition: The Surviving Insured Conversion rider/option allows the surviving insured on a joint policy to convert that policy to an individual policy after the death of the other joint insured.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SURVAB
Definition: Retirement income benefit of survivor of an insured individual

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_SURVIR
Definition: Death benefit paid after all insureds dieFor reinsurance messages, the LREACT mappings treat the base coverage as the policy with all riders being sent as options on the base coverage. Thus, certain codes that are traditionally riders are needed as options.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_TERMINALILL
Definition: This accelerated benefit rider allows the client to take an advance on the policy's death benefit due to a terminal illness.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_WMD
Definition: In flexible premium policies, the WMD rider causes the monthly deductions of the policy to be waived upon the disability of the primary insured.The WMD rider also keeps no lapse guarantee provisions in effect.

Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_WP
Definition: A provision that sets certain conditions under which an insurance policy will be kept in full force by the company without the payment of premiums. It is used most frequently for those policyholders that become totally and permanently disabled but may be available in certain other cases.ORThe waiver of premium rider provides that the insurance company will not collect premiums for a period of time during which the insured is disabled.This type of rider is typically used for products that have a fixed premium structure such as traditional whole life or term.

Description: Waiver of Surr Chrgs on Nursing Home Confinement
Name: OLI_OPTTYPE_WSCNH
Definition: The benefit provides that if the insured is confined to a nursing home or similar facility by a physician and requests a withdrawal from his/her policy, the surrender charge, if any, and withdrawal charge will be waived for that withdrawal (assuming all other business criteria have been met).No charges will be waived under this benefit resulting from a decrease in the basic insurance amount or a change on the type of death benefit.
